dialogue.text: In the middle of 15th century england is in a dire political position. Henry vi is the eleventh plantagenet monarch of the state. Crown'd at 1 year fusty after his father and former king's passing.

That gent wast a feeble and meak monarch responsible for england's defeat and loss of territories to the french. England hast just hath lost the 100 year longeth war with france, the piece however shall not lasteth longeth
Edward ?, Edward ? oh yond issue of mineth!. Edward ! the duke of york and his sons has't arrived ! a prince shouldst greeteth important guests himself.
mine own queen, if 't be true you're looking f'r the young prince, i did see that gent earlier in the backeth garden playing with the young Earl of Richmond.
Henry Tudor? has't thee seen his uncle 'round?
The Earl of Pembroke wast visiting the king's chambers
ahhhg, liketh father liketh son. By the heavens lightning am i the only one who is't rememb'r'd y'rk's visiteth.
thy majesty , thee knoweth better than anyone yond his highness hast been humor unwell as of late. And I am certain the prince is excited about york coming.
the prince, is too naive and kind heart'd f'r his owneth valorous. he is the son of his father. If 't be true that gent is to beest king that gent wilt attendeth all his duties
Castle gardens
hyaah!
too sloppy thy majesty ! , and anon, the finishing toucheth
ouuuuch, i hath lost again. i don't knoweth about this henry ?
doth thee wanna play something else?
I guesseth but, i'm did suppose to beest valorous at this, i'm did suppose to becometh stout liketh mother. And not caterwauling liketh this , king's don't caterwauling !
Doest thy father, i cullionly his majesty, ever caterwauling ?
yes, many times

War is over Edward , there's nae needeth to beest stout and th're's nay needeth to square. And in peaceful times i bethink you'd maketh a most wondrous king. Coequal if 't be true sword fighting isn't thy stout pointeth.
thank thee Henry
Margaret enters the scene with Richard Duke of York and his children Edward, George and Richard
There thou art boys ! in earnest thee can't just disappeareth at which hour we've did get such important guests Edward
i'm deeply sorry mother
and Henry, i shalt speaketh with thy fath'r about this later
i'm very sorry thy grace !
Enow with the apologies, Edward properly greeteth the Duke of York.
holla prince edward, you've grown since i lasteth did see thee. How's yond wooden sword treating thee?
Greetings lord of york, waiteth! is Richar- i cullionly art thy sons accompanying thee ?
Edward don’t beest malapert !
Haha of course, the youth art the future of this ground, i wilt instructeth mine own sons i mine own duties, jus liketh thy mother tries h'r most wondrous to instructeth thee.
Greetings thy highness
Ho, you've grown, ehghmm thy clarity!
Riiiiiiiiichard !!!
runs and hugs that gent
Edward , thy manners!!!
Ho richard we've did miss thee
Henry don’t indulge in-

hahaha, relaxeth mine own queen. Those gents art still but children, i might not but admiteth i misseth the tend'r simpleness of childhood. Nay wars, nay political conflicts , free from all yond burdens us adults.
What burdens us? What we burden ourselves with is what pulls this ground forward. Thee hath said it yourself lord of york, the youth art future of this ground, wast t not?
Aye forsooth, those gents art the future, but the presenteth if 't be true ours, speaking off wherefore hasn't his majesty did greet us formally ?
Oh mine own deepest apologies, mine own husband’s sickness hast been worsening. That gent is did attend by servants and barely exits his chambers as of late.
I seeth Is an audience with that gent impossible so?
Not at all , that gent shall certes beest eager to speaketh with thee, Jaspe tudor is with that gent at the moment.
The Earl of Pembroke i understand you not ?
King's Chamb'rs
